infodynamics.utils

Class UnivariateNearestNeighbourSearcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.utils.NearestNeighbourSearcher
      • infodynamics.utils.UnivariateNearestNeighbourSearcher

  • public class UnivariateNearestNeighbourSearcher
extends NearestNeighbourSearcher
    Class for fast neighbour searching in a single dimensional variable. Instantiates a sorted array for this purpose. Norms for the nearest neighbour searches are the max norm or Euclidean norm (squared) within each variable.
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

    • Field Summary

      protected int[] sortedArrayIndices

      An array of the original values sorted into ascending order.

      int countPointsSmallerAndOutsideR(int sampleIndex, double r, boolean allowEqualToR)
      Count the number of points less than the sample at the given index, and outside norm r.
      int countPointsWithinR(double[][] sampleVectors, double r, boolean allowEqualToR)
      As per NearestNeighbourSearcher.countPointsWithinR(int, double, boolean) however the search is to match a specified sample point (not a sample point within the search space itself).

      As per countPointsWithinR(int, double, boolean, boolean[]) only for a specific data point.

      As per countPointsWithinR(double, double, boolean) however for a specific sample value (not one within the data set itself).
      int countPointsWithinR(double sampleValue, double r, boolean allowEqualToR, boolean[] additionalCriteria)

      int countPointsWithinR(int sampleIndex, double r, boolean allowEqualToR)
      Count the number of points within norm r for a given sample index in the data set.
      int countPointsWithinR(int sampleIndex, double r, boolean allowEqualToR, boolean[] additionalCriteria)
      As per NearestNeighbourSearcher.countPointsWithinR(int, double, boolean) however each point is subject to also meeting the additional criteria of being true in additionalCriteria.
      int countPointsWithinR(int sampleIndex, double r, boolean allowEqualToR, boolean[] additionalCriteria, int[] remapping)
      As per NearestNeighbourSearcher.countPointsWithinR(int, double, boolean) however each point is subject to also meeting the additional criteria of being true in additionalCriteria, and the search points are reindexed according to the remapping specified in remapping

      double sumDistanceAboveThresholdForPointsWithinRs(int sampleIndex, double r_upper, double r_lower, boolean allowEqualToR)
      For the points within norms r_upper and r_lower for a given sample index in the data set, sum up the total amount that all of these points are above r_lower.

      • findNearestNeighbour

        public NeighbourNodeData findNearestNeighbour(int sampleIndex)
        Return the node which is the nearest neighbour for a given sample index in the data set. The node itself is excluded from the search.
        Specified by:
        findNearestNeighbour in class NearestNeighbourSearcher
        Parameters:
        sampleIndex - sample index in the data to find a nearest neighbour for
        Returns:
        the node for the nearest neighbour.

      • findKNearestNeighbours

        public java.util.PriorityQueue<NeighbourNodeData> findKNearestNeighbours(int K,
                                                                int sampleIndex)
                                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Return the K nodes which are the K nearest neighbours for a given sample index in the data set. The node itself is excluded from the search. Nearest neighbour function to compare to r is the specified norm.
        Specified by:
        findKNearestNeighbours in class NearestNeighbourSearcher
        Parameters:
        K - number of K nearest neighbours to return, sorted from furthest away first to nearest last.
        sampleIndex - sample index in the data to find the K nearest neighbours for
        Returns:
        a PriorityQueue of nodes for the K nearest neighbours, sorted with furthest neighbour first in the PQ.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • findKNearestNeighbours

        public java.util.PriorityQueue<NeighbourNodeData> findKNearestNeighbours(int K,
                                                                int sampleIndex,
                                                                int dynCorrExclTime)
                                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Return the K nodes which are the K nearest neighbours for a given sample index in the data set. Nodes within dynCorrExclTime time points are excluded from the search. Nearest neighbour function to compare to r is the specified norm.
        Specified by:
        findKNearestNeighbours in class NearestNeighbourSearcher
        Parameters:
        K - number of K nearest neighbours to return, sorted from furthest away first to nearest last.
        sampleIndex - sample index in the data to find the K nearest neighbours for
        dynCorrExclTime - Range around sampleIndex to exclude points from the count. Is >= 0.
        Returns:
        a PriorityQueue of nodes for the K nearest neighbours, sorted with furthest neighbour first in the PQ.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • countPointsWithinR

        public int countPointsWithinR(int sampleIndex,
                     double r,
                     boolean allowEqualToR)
        Count the number of points within norm r for a given sample index in the data set. The node itself is excluded from the search. Nearest neighbour function to compare to r is the specified norm. (If EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN was selected, then the supplied r should be the required Euclidean norm squared, since we switch it to EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN_SQUARED internally).
        Specified by:
        countPointsWithinR in class NearestNeighbourSearcher
        Parameters:
        sampleIndex - sample index in the data to find a nearest neighbour for
        r - radius within which to count points
        allowEqualToR - if true, then count points at radius r also, otherwise only those strictly within r
        Returns:
        the count of points within r.

      • countPointsWithinRs

        public int countPointsWithinRs(int sampleIndex,
                      double r_upper,
                      double r_lower,
                      boolean allowEqualToR)
        Count the number of points within norms r_upper and r_lower for a given sample index in the data set. The node itself is excluded from the search. Nearest neighbour function to compare to radii is the specified norm. (If EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN was selected, then the supplied r should be the required Euclidean norm squared, since we switch it to EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN_SQUARED internally).

      • sumDistanceAboveThresholdForPointsWithinRs

        public double sumDistanceAboveThresholdForPointsWithinRs(int sampleIndex,
                                                double r_upper,
                                                double r_lower,
                                                boolean allowEqualToR)
        For the points within norms r_upper and r_lower for a given sample index in the data set, sum up the total amount that all of these points are above r_lower. The node itself is excluded from the search. Nearest neighbour function to compare to radii is the specified norm. (If EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN was selected, then the supplied r should be the required Euclidean norm squared, since we switch it to EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN_SQUARED internally).

      • countPointsWithinR

        public int countPointsWithinR(int sampleIndex,
                     double r,
                     int dynCorrExclTime,
                     boolean allowEqualToR)
        Count the number of points within norm r for a given sample index in the data set. Nodes within dynCorrExclTime of sampleIndex are excluded from the search. Nearest neighbour function to compare to r is the specified norm. (If EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN was selected, then the supplied r should be the required Euclidean norm squared, since we switch it to EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN_SQUARED internally).
        Specified by:
        countPointsWithinR in class NearestNeighbourSearcher
        Parameters:
        sampleIndex - sample index in the data to find a nearest neighbour for
        r - radius within which to count points
        dynCorrExclTime - time window within which to exclude points to be counted. Is >= 0. 0 means only exclude sampleIndex.
        allowEqualToR - if true, then count points at radius r also, otherwise only those strictly within r
        Returns:
        the count of points within r.

      • countPointsWithinROrLarger

        public int countPointsWithinROrLarger(int sampleIndex,
                             double r,
                             boolean allowEqualToR)
        Count the number of points within norm r for a given sample index in the data set, or larger than r. The node itself is excluded from the search. Nearest neighbour function to compare to r is the specified norm. (If EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN was selected, then the supplied r should be the required Euclidean norm squared, since we switch it to EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN_SQUARED internally).

      • countPointsSmallerAndOutsideR

        public int countPointsSmallerAndOutsideR(int sampleIndex,
                                double r,
                                boolean allowEqualToR)
        Count the number of points less than the sample at the given index, and outside norm r. allowEqualToR means to be considered same as the sample. The node itself is excluded from the search. Nearest neighbour function to compare to r is the specified norm. (If EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN was selected, then the supplied r should be the required Euclidean norm squared, since we switch it to EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN_SQUARED internally).

                     double r,
                     boolean allowEqualToR)
        Description copied from class: NearestNeighbourSearcher
        As per NearestNeighbourSearcher.countPointsWithinR(int, double, boolean) however the search is to match a specified sample point (not a sample point within the search space itself).
        Specified by:
        countPointsWithinR in class NearestNeighbourSearcher
        Parameters:
        sampleVectors - sample vectors to find the neighbours within r for
        r - radius within which to count points
        allowEqualToR - if true, then count points at radius r also, otherwise only those strictly within r
        Returns:
        the count of points within r.

      • countPointsWithinR

        public int countPointsWithinR(double sampleValue,
                     double r,
                     boolean allowEqualToR)
        As per countPointsWithinR(double, double, boolean) however for a specific sample value (not one within the data set itself).
        Parameters:
        sampleValue - the specific value to search for

      • findPointsWithinR

        public java.util.Collection<NeighbourNodeData> findPointsWithinR(int sampleIndex,
                                                        double r,
                                                        boolean allowEqualToR)
        Find the collection of points within norm r for a given sample index in the data set. The node itself is excluded from the search. Nearest neighbour function to compare to r is the specified norm. (If EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN was selected, then the supplied r should be the required Euclidean norm squared, since we switch it to EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN_SQUARED internally).
        Specified by:
        findPointsWithinR in class NearestNeighbourSearcher
        Parameters:
        sampleIndex - sample index in the data to find a nearest neighbour for
        r - radius within which to count points
        allowEqualToR - if true, then count points at radius r also, otherwise only those strictly within r
        Returns:
        the collection of points within r.

      • findPointsWithinR

        public int findPointsWithinR(int sampleIndex,
                    double r,
                    boolean allowEqualToR,
                    boolean[] isWithinR,
                    int[] indicesWithinR)
        Record the collection of points within norm r for a given sample index in the data set. The node itself is excluded from the search. Nearest neighbour function to compare to r is the specified norm. (If EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN was selected, then the supplied r should be the required Euclidean norm squared, since we switch it to EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN_SQUARED internally).

        The recording of nearest neighbours is made within the isWithinR and indicesWithinR arrays, which must be constructed before calling this method, with length at or exceeding the total number of data points. indicesWithinR is

        Specified by:
        findPointsWithinR in class NearestNeighbourSearcher
        Parameters:
        sampleIndex - sample index in the data to find a nearest neighbour for
        r - radius within which to count points
        allowEqualToR - if true, then count points at radius r also, otherwise only those strictly within r
        isWithinR - the array MUST be passed in with all points set to false initially, and is returned indicating whether each sample was found to be within r of that at sampleIndex.
        indicesWithinR - a list of array indices for points marked as true in isWithinR, terminated with a -1 value.
        Returns:
        the number of matching points found

      • findPointsWithinR

        public void findPointsWithinR(int sampleIndex,
                     double r,
                     int dynCorrExclTime,
                     boolean allowEqualToR,
                     boolean[] isWithinR,
                     int[] indicesWithinR)
        Record the collection of points within norm r for a given sample index in the data set. The node itself is excluded from the search. Nearest neighbour function to compare to r is the specified norm. (If EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN was selected, then the supplied r should be the required Euclidean norm squared, since we switch it to EuclideanUtils.NORM_EUCLIDEAN_SQUARED internally).

        The recording of nearest neighbours is made within the isWithinR and indicesWithinR arrays, which must be constructed before calling this method, with length at or exceeding the total number of data points. indicesWithinR is

        Specified by:
        findPointsWithinR in class NearestNeighbourSearcher
        Parameters:
        sampleIndex - sample index in the data to find a nearest neighbour for
        r - radius within which to count points
        dynCorrExclTime - time window within which to exclude points to be counted. Is >= 0. 0 means only exclude sampleIndex.
        allowEqualToR - if true, then count points at radius r also, otherwise only those strictly within r
        isWithinR - the array MUST be passed in with all points set to false initially, and is returned indicating whether each sample was found to be within r of that at sampleIndex.
        indicesWithinR - a list of array indices for points marked as true in isWithinR, terminated with a -1 value.

      • findPointsWithinR

        public int findPointsWithinR(int sampleIndex,
                    double r,
                    int dynCorrExclTime,
                    boolean allowEqualToR,
                    boolean[] isWithinR,
                    double[] distancesWithinRInOrder,
                    double[][] distancesAndIndicesWithinR)
        Description copied from class: NearestNeighbourSearcher
        As per NearestNeighbourSearcher.findPointsWithinR(int, double, boolean, boolean[], int[]) however incorporates dynamic correlation exclusion.

        Specified by:
        findPointsWithinR in class NearestNeighbourSearcher
        Parameters:
        sampleIndex - sample index in the data to find a nearest neighbour for
        r - radius within which to count points
        dynCorrExclTime - time window within which to exclude points to be counted. Is >= 0. 0 means only exclude sampleIndex.
        allowEqualToR - if true, then count points at radius r also, otherwise only those strictly within r
        isWithinR - the array MUST be passed in with all points set to false initially, and is returned indicating whether each sample was found to be within r of that at sampleIndex.
        distancesWithinRInOrder - the array must be passed in and is returned with distances for each point found to be within r. Values at other indices are not defined.
        distancesAndIndicesWithinR - is returned as a list of distances (in column index 0) and array indices (in column index 1) for points marked as true in isWithinR, terminated with a -1 value on the index.
        Returns:
        the point count

      • findPointsWithinRAndTakeRadiusMax

        public int findPointsWithinRAndTakeRadiusMax(int sampleIndex,
                                    double r,
                                    int dynCorrExclTime,
                                    boolean allowEqualToR,
                                    boolean[] additionalCriteria,
                                    double[] reportDistancesAsMaxWith,
                                    double[][] distancesAndIndicesWithinR)
        As per findPointsWithinR(int, double, int, boolean, boolean[], double[], double[][]) only we have additional criteria, and we report max values taking that additional criteria into account.
        Parameters:
        sampleIndex - sample index in the data to find a nearest neighbour for
        r - radius within which to count points
        dynCorrExclTime - time window within which to exclude points to be counted. Is >= 0. 0 means only exclude sampleIndex.
        allowEqualToR - if true, then count points at radius r also, otherwise only those strictly within r
        additionalCriteria - an array indicating whether each sample for should be tested for this search point
        reportDistancesAsMaxWith - an array of distances for points flagged in additionalCriteria: distancesAndIndicesWithinR should return the max of this value or the distances within r computed here. Values at indices where distances are not within r are not defined.
        distancesAndIndicesWithinR - a list of distances (in column index 0) and array indices (in column index 1) for points found to be within r, terminated with a -1 value on the index.
        Returns:
        the next available index in distancesAndIndicesWithinR after the method is complete

      • findPointsWithinR

        public void findPointsWithinR(double r,
                     double[][] sampleVectors,
                     boolean allowEqualToR,
                     boolean[] isWithinR,
                     int[] indicesWithinR)
        As per findPointsWithinR(int, double, int, boolean, boolean[], int[]) only for a specific data point. Note that the method signature takes a 2D sample vector, however since this is class only searches univariate spaces, then there must only be one value in #sampleVector (i.e. length one on both array indices).
        Specified by:
        findPointsWithinR in class NearestNeighbourSearcher
        Parameters:
        r - radius within which to count points
        sampleVectors - sample vectors to find the neighbours within r for
        allowEqualToR - if true, then count points at radius r also, otherwise only those strictly within r
        isWithinR - the array MUST be passed in with all points set to false initially, and is returned indicating whether each sample was found to be within r of that at sampleIndex.
        indicesWithinR - a list of array indices for points marked as true in isWithinR, terminated with a -1 value.
        See Also:
        #findPointsWithinR(double, double[][], boolean, boolean[], int[])}

      • findPointsWithinR

        public void findPointsWithinR(double r,
                     double sampleValue,
                     boolean allowEqualToR,
                     boolean[] isWithinR,
                     int[] indicesWithinR)
        As per findPointsWithinR(int, double, int, boolean, boolean[], int[]) only for a specific data point.
        Parameters:
        sampleValue - the specific point being searched (not a data point in the search structure)
        See Also:
        #findPointsWithinR(double, double[][], boolean, boolean[], int[])}

      • countPointsWithinR

        public int countPointsWithinR(int sampleIndex,
                     double r,
                     boolean allowEqualToR,
                     boolean[] additionalCriteria)
        Description copied from class: NearestNeighbourSearcher
        As per NearestNeighbourSearcher.countPointsWithinR(int, double, boolean) however each point is subject to also meeting the additional criteria of being true in additionalCriteria.
        Specified by:
        countPointsWithinR in class NearestNeighbourSearcher
        Parameters:
        sampleIndex - sample index in the data to find a nearest neighbour for
        r - radius within which to count points
        allowEqualToR - if true, then count points at radius r also, otherwise only those strictly within r
        additionalCriteria - array of booleans. Only count a point if it is within r and is true in additionalCrtieria.
        Returns:
        the count of points within r.

      • countPointsWithinR

        public int countPointsWithinR(int sampleIndex,
                     double r,
                     boolean allowEqualToR,
                     boolean[] additionalCriteria,
                     int[] remapping)
        Description copied from class: NearestNeighbourSearcher
        As per NearestNeighbourSearcher.countPointsWithinR(int, double, boolean) however each point is subject to also meeting the additional criteria of being true in additionalCriteria, and the search points are reindexed according to the remapping specified in remapping
        Specified by:
        countPointsWithinR in class NearestNeighbourSearcher
        Parameters:
        sampleIndex - sample index in the data to find a nearest neighbour for (already remapped if required)
        r - radius within which to count points
        allowEqualToR - if true, then count points at radius r also, otherwise only those strictly within r
        additionalCriteria - array of booleans. Only count a point if it is within r and is true in additionalCrtieria.
        remapping - array of time indices with which to remap the search points onto the same time index space as the additionalCriteria (this will apply to the supplied sampleIndex as well as other search points)
        Returns:
        the count of points within r.

      • countPointsWithinR

        public int countPointsWithinR(double[][] sampleVectors,
                     double r,
                     boolean allowEqualToR,
                     boolean[] additionalCriteria)
        As per countPointsWithinR(int, double, boolean, boolean[]) only for a specific data point. Note that the method signature takes a 2D sample vector, however since this is class only searches univariate spaces, then there must only be one value in #sampleVector (i.e. length one on both array indices).
        Specified by:
        countPointsWithinR in class NearestNeighbourSearcher
        Parameters:
        sampleVectors - sample vectors to find the neighbours within r for
        r - radius within which to count points
        allowEqualToR - if true, then count points at radius r also, otherwise only those strictly within r
        additionalCriteria - array of booleans. Only count a point if it is within r and is true in additionalCrtieria.
        Returns:
        the count of points within r.
        See Also:
        #findPointsWithinR(double, double[][], boolean, boolean[], int[])}

      • countPointsWithinR

        public int countPointsWithinR(double sampleValue,
                     double r,
                     boolean allowEqualToR,
                     boolean[] additionalCriteria)
        As per countPointsWithinR(int, double, boolean, boolean[]) only for a specific data point.
        Parameters:
        sampleValue - the specific point being searched (not a data point in the search structure)
